Wondered about using thin Styrofoam for this. Guess there would be no chemical reaction problem with Styrofoam? Balsa wood might be as easy to work with and more durable. Guess I'll have to sit down and experiment with these ideas. 

Ron
STL
  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: alchemyst 
  To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Tuesday, October 19, 2004 3:24 PM
  Subject: [nihontostudy] Re: tsuba boxes



  Ron -

  Styrofoam can be simply cut or scooped out to most
  any shape. Then covered with silk should do the
  job and look good. Not traditional maybe, but easy
  to do and looks good.

  Rich S
